summary: The course is a hybrid workshop offered by Bar-Ilan University for data managers, focusing on data science and generative AI for technological managers. It covers a comprehensive range of topics including an overview of artificial intelligence and machine learning, supervised, unsupervised, and semi-supervised learning, model selection, deep learning, and reinforcement learning. The course also delves into the complete data science pipeline process, data science operation management, and managing data science initiatives efficiently. Participants will learn about successful organizational ML-OPS processes, data science tools and technologies, industry and market trends, real-world use cases, and best practices. Additionally, the course explores large language models, generative AI solutions, prompt engineering, retrieval-augmented generation, and fine-tuning techniques. The course is designed to equip participants with the knowledge to manage data science units and initiatives effectively.
full_text:
COURSE NAME: Data Science & GenAI for Technological Managers. 

COURSE OVERVIEW: The course is designed to equip technological managers with the necessary skills and knowledge in data science and generative AI. Participants will learn about the latest trends and technologies in the field, enabling them to influence the future today. 

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 19.12.2024. 
- Schedule: Mondays and Thursdays, from 17:30 to 21:30. 
- Duration: 5 sessions, totaling 25 academic hours. 

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- The course is hybrid. 
- Classes will be held at Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, according to participants' preference. 

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Data Science: 
  - Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Overview. 
  - Supervised, Unsupervised, and Semi-Supervised Learning. 
  - Model Selection, including Straightforward Models and Ensembled Models. 
  - Deep Learning: Neural Networks Concepts & Engineering. 
  - Reinforcement Learning. 
  - The complete data science pipeline process. 

- Data Science Operation Management: 
  - Managing Data Science Initiatives Life Cycle. 
  - Building and Managing the Data Science unit efficiently. 
  - Successful organizational ML-OPS process. 
  - Data Science Tools & Technologies. 

- Data Science Tools & Technologies: 
  - Industry & Market watch. 
  - Real-world use cases & Best Practices. 
  - Large Language Models (NLP / NLU) and Omni Models. 
  - Generative AI: off-the-shelf solutions, platforms, self-development, and in between. 
  - Key approaches: Prompt Engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Preferences Fine-Tuning (PFT), Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), etc. 
  - Project Milestones, Technologies & Process (e.g., Tokenization, embedding, Vector DBs, etc.). 

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or esther.asulin@biu.ac.il. 

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.
